Signing this notice

If you're sending this notice by email you can sign it without printing the notice.

You can sign a Word document by opening the document in Microsoft Word and typing your name where you need to sign.

If you're signing a PDF, you can open the PDF in Adobe Acrobat Reader DC and use Adobe's 'fill & sign' tool.

If you don't have Adobe Acrobat Reader DC you can get it as a free download. You can also read Adobe's advice about signing a PDF if you need more help.

Keep a version saved

You should keep a record of emails you send to and receive from your tenant.

Your tenant's response to this notice

This notice includes a tenant's response page. Your tenant can fill in this page to:

  • accept the rent increase
  • if they haven't received 3 months' notice, advise they won't need to pay the new amount until 3 months have passed from getting this notice
  • tell you that they don't think the new rent amount is fair

If your tenant doesn't think the new rent amount is fair they can apply to Rent Service Scotland (RSS). It's RSS's job to rule on what's a fair rent.

Your tenant can only apply to RSS if they don't live in a Rent Pressure Zone.

Your tenant doesn't need to fill in the tenant's response. If they don't respond, the rent increase will apply from the date you've asked for in the notice.

Giving your tenant this notice

You must give your tenant this notice in the way agreed in your tenancy agreement.
